chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas A Korth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/Costs to be paid at the rate or $50.00 per month commencing 08/01/2016 ore penalty of 10 days Huber for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas A Korth

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Schleis makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following to count #2:
FINE: $883.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Total costs/fine/forfeiture: to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/2016.  Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 10 days in Huber
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has obtained a DL.  Attorney Schleis is going to be giving the state a requested offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney appears by authorization.  Next date is the deadline to file motions.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant qualifies for a public defender.  Hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant advises the Court he would like to represent himself.  The Court orders the Defendant is to contact the District Attorney to obtain a global offer and to check into retaining counsel.  Hearing scheduled for March 21, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is working on getting his DL back.  Hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

Defendant Nicholas A Korth in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
